name: Million Gold Eau de Parfum Intense
about: Fragrance Family:Earthy & Woody.Scent Type:Citrus & Woods.Key Notes:Mandarin, Cedarwood, Sandalwood.Fragrance Description:Million Gold Eau de Parfum Intense is Rabanne’s newest interpretation of the Million man. An ultra woody and vibrant men’s cologne blends fresh mandarin with warm cedarwood, creamy sandalwood, and the hot-cool spice of cinnamon to create the intoxicating sensuality of the Million Gold man..About the Bottle:This bottle is sleeker and more powerful than ever. The new design of Rabanne’s emblematic Million bottle expresses the irreverent refinement of the Million man. The legendary gold ingot comes with a new stand-out detail that remains embedded in La Maison´s rich history: the iconic XL link. As a true statement piece, the new creation expresses Rabanne’s vision of masculine confidence. The ultimate symbol of golden success..About the Fragrance:Dive into a world of golden exhilaration with Million Gold Eau de Parfum Intense. This scent is a bold statement that rewrites the vision of Million masculinity. It contains notes of fresh mandarin spiked with a flash of cardamom to set the tempo, at the heart a creamy and vibrant sandalwood for an ultra woody and vibrant addiction. It also contains notes of of cinnamon and cedarwood for a long-lasting trail. The intoxicating sensuality of the Million Gold man.
ingredients: Alcohol Denat., Parfum (Fragrance), Aqua (Water), Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Limonene, Coumarin, Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone, Hydroxycitronellal, Linalool, Alcohol, Tris(Tetramethylhydroxypiperidinol) Citrate, Cinnamal, Citral, Eugenol, Geraniol, Ci 19140 (Yellow 5), Ci 14700 (Red 4).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Fragrance is intensified by the warmth of your own body. Apply in the creases of your knees and elbows for a longer-lasting, stronger scent. .-After applying, avoid rubbing or dabbing skin. This breaks down the fragrance, causing it to wear off more quickly. .-If you prefer placing fragrance on your wrists, be sure to reapply after frequent hand-washing, as this tends to rinse off the scent. .-Replace fragrance after 12 months. Expired perfumes more than a year old lose the integrity of the original scent...Eau de Toilette or Eau de Parfum?: .The difference lies in the volume of perfume oil. While EDT contains five to nine percent, EDP contains more, usually eight to 14 percent. EDPs, therefore, last longer and smell more intense.
